glsa.title: Pulseaudio: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in pulseaudio may allow a local user to execute actions with escalated privileges.

background.p: Pulseaudio is a networked sound server with an advanced plugin system.

description.p: Marcus Meissner from SUSE reported that the pa_drop_root() function does not properly check the return value of the system calls setuid(), seteuid(), setresuid() and setreuid() when dropping its privileges.

impact.p: A local attacker could cause a resource exhaustion to make the system calls fail, which would cause Pulseaudio to run as root. The attacker could then perform actions with root privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
